metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5261 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in SPICE before 0.12.6 allows guest OS users toread and write to arbitrary memory locations on the host via guest QXLcommands related to surface creation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.2
spice-client - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.2').
